intro: Pyrus cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese white pear, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its white flowers and edible fruit. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges. The fruit, which ripens in autumn, is used in traditional Chinese medicine and culinary applications.
